trans-unit.source: ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.
trans-unit.target: ACS namespaces can migrate their Google identity provider configurations from OpenID 2.0 to OpenID Connect.

trans-unit.source: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.
trans-unit.target: Migration must be completed before June 1, 2015.

trans-unit.source: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed guidance, see <link xlink:href="abed9a15-8466-4c3a-80e0-8fa24a3ea0f7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Migrating ACS Namespaces to Google OpenID Connect</link>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to configure the following components of <token>firstref_acs</token>:
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to configure the following components of <token>firstref_acs</token>:

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Identity providers</legacyBold>—Such as <token>ms_acct</token>, Google, Facebook, Yahoo!, and WS-Federation identity providers (for example, <token>secondref_adfs2</token>).
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Identity providers</legacyBold>—Such as <token>ms_acct</token>, Google, Facebook, Yahoo!, and WS-Federation identity providers (for example, <token>secondref_adfs2</token>).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Identity Providers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Identity Providers</link>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Relying party applications</legacyBold>—These are your web applications or services that you want to interact with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Relying party applications</legacyBold>—These are your web applications or services that you want to interact with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Rule groups and rules</legacyBold>—Rules, contained in rule groups, define which claims are passed from identity providers to relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Rule groups and rules</legacyBold>—Rules, contained in rule groups, define which claims are passed from identity providers to relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Certificates and keys</legacyBold>—In an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, these credentials are used for token signing, encryption, and decryption.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Certificates and keys</legacyBold>—In an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, these credentials are used for token signing, encryption, and decryption.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Service identities</legacyBold>—Autonomous applications and services can use these credentials to authenticate directly with <token>secondref_acs</token> and receive tokens.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Service identities</legacyBold>—Autonomous applications and services can use these credentials to authenticate directly with <token>secondref_acs</token> and receive tokens.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Portal administrators</legacyBold>—You can grant administrative access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal for a specific <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> to users from selected identity providers.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Portal administrators</legacyBold>—You can grant administrative access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal for a specific <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> to users from selected identity providers.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="a67f7e99-a7dd-4cfc-b214-a653a00a2783" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Portal Administrators</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="a67f7e99-a7dd-4cfc-b214-a653a00a2783" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Portal Administrators</link>.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Management Service</legacyBold>—You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to add new or manage existing accounts for accessing the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Management Service</legacyBold>—You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to add new or manage existing accounts for accessing the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="f69b173a-fcf8-4f59-864a-09b05541d3df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS 2.0 Management Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the previous list, you can also use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal’s <ui>Application Integration</ui> section to get the code required to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with your relying party applications.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the previous list, you can also use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal’s <ui>Application Integration</ui> section to get the code required to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with your relying party applications.

trans-unit.source: Working with the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Working with the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: The following section describes how to navigate the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal in order to configure various components of <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following section describes how to navigate the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal in order to configure various components of <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: You can launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal though the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal though the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, you must first create a new or have an existing Azure namespace.
trans-unit.target: To launch the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, you must first create a new or have an existing Azure namespace.

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create or Modify a Azure ACS Service Namespace</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create or Modify a Azure ACS Service Namespace</link>.

trans-unit.source: When an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is created, it is provisioned with a single portal administrator account.
trans-unit.target: When an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is created, it is provisioned with a single portal administrator account.

trans-unit.source: This is the same account that is used to create the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This is the same account that is used to create the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: This account is immutable and cannot be deleted within the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: This account is immutable and cannot be deleted within the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: To launch the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To launch the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal <userInput> Home</userInput> page, you can do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal <userInput> Home</userInput> page, you can do the following:

trans-unit.source: To add new or manage existing relying party applications, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To add new or manage existing relying party applications, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To add new or manage existing identity providers, click <ui>Identity providers</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To add new or manage existing identity providers, click <ui>Identity providers</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To add new or manage existing rule groups and rules, click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To add new or manage existing rule groups and rules, click <ui>Rule groups</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To add new or manage existing certificates and keys, click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To add new or manage existing certificates and keys, click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To add new or manage existing service identities, click <ui>Service identities</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To add new or manage existing service identities, click <ui>Service identities</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To add new or manage existing portal administrators, click <ui>Portal administrators</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To add new or manage existing portal administrators, click <ui>Portal administrators</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To add new or manage existing accounts for accessing the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, click <ui>Management service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To add new or manage existing accounts for accessing the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Service, click <ui>Management service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: To get the code required to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with your relying party applications, click <ui>Application integration</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To get the code required to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with your relying party applications, click <ui>Application integration</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Signing Out of the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Signing Out of the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: When you use a <token>ms_acct</token> administrative account to access the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, and then you click the <ui>Sign Out</ui> link, you are signed out of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and out of your <token>ms_acct</token>.
trans-unit.target: When you use a <token>ms_acct</token> administrative account to access the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, and then you click the <ui>Sign Out</ui> link, you are signed out of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and out of your <token>ms_acct</token>.

trans-unit.source: If you access the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal with a Google, Yahoo!, or Facebook administrative account, the <ui>Sign out</ui> link signs you out of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, but it does not sign you out of your identity provider.
trans-unit.target: If you access the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal with a Google, Yahoo!, or Facebook administrative account, the <ui>Sign out</ui> link signs you out of the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, but it does not sign you out of your identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Localization in Eleven Languages
trans-unit.target: Localization in Eleven Languages

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and the <token>secondref_acs</token>-hosted login page for relying party applications now support localization in eleven written languages, including English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Russian, Spanish, Portuguese (Brazil), Simplified Chinese, and Traditional Chinese.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and the <token>secondref_acs</token>-hosted login page for relying party applications now support localization in eleven written languages, including English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Russian, Spanish, Portuguese (Brazil), Simplified Chinese, and Traditional Chinese.

trans-unit.source: An “English (International)” option is also available that uses an alternate date format for setting and displaying effective/expiration dates for keys.
trans-unit.target: An “English (International)” option is also available that uses an alternate date format for setting and displaying effective/expiration dates for keys.

trans-unit.source: The written language displayed for these user interfaces can be changed in one of the following three ways:
trans-unit.target: The written language displayed for these user interfaces can be changed in one of the following three ways:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Language Selector</embeddedLabel> – In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, the displayed language can be instantly changed using a new language selector menu that appears in the upper-right corner of the portal.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Language Selector</embeddedLabel> – In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, the displayed language can be instantly changed using a new language selector menu that appears in the upper-right corner of the portal.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>URL</embeddedLabel> – The language displayed in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal can be changed by adding a “lang” parameter to the end of the request URL.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>URL</embeddedLabel> – The language displayed in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal can be changed by adding a “lang” parameter to the end of the request URL.

trans-unit.source: The legal values for this parameter are ISO 639-1/3166 language codes that correspond to a supported language.
trans-unit.target: The legal values for this parameter are ISO 639-1/3166 language codes that correspond to a supported language.

trans-unit.source: Examples values include en, de, es, fr, it, ja, ko, ru, pt-br, zh-cn, and zh-tw.
trans-unit.target: Examples values include en, de, es, fr, it, ja, ko, ru, pt-br, zh-cn, and zh-tw.

trans-unit.source: Below is an example <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal URL with a parameter setting the displayed language to French:
trans-unit.target: Below is an example <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal URL with a parameter setting the displayed language to French:

trans-unit.source: https://your-namespace.accesscontrol.windows.net/?lang=fr
trans-unit.target: https://your-namespace.accesscontrol.windows.net/?lang=fr

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Web Browser Preferences</embeddedLabel> – If the “lang” URL parameter or language selector has never been used to set a language preference, then the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and <token>secondref_acs</token>-hosted login pages will determine the default language to display based on the language preferences set in the web browser settings.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Web Browser Preferences</embeddedLabel> – If the “lang” URL parameter or language selector has never been used to set a language preference, then the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and <token>secondref_acs</token>-hosted login pages will determine the default language to display based on the language preferences set in the web browser settings.
